name: NPC DOSSIER (GM): Lord Mayor Alden Rutherford

text.content:
Secret: Alden permits Zhentarim movement and selective contraband in exchange for ‘reduced violence’ and a quiet promise to keep the east-road threats away from town.

Leverage on him: Proof of payments, meeting notes, or Varron Dusk’s written orders.

If confronted privately: he offers a deal: help him keep stability while he ‘phases out’ the Zhent (he might mean it, but he’s trapped).

If confronted publicly: Magistrate Fen moves to arrest/banish the loudest accuser unless Captain Voss intervenes.

Secret: Harper operative. Uses patrol logs as coded intel and routes Harper couriers through the inn and south farms.

Leverage: Proof of her Harper identity can ruin her, but she has counter-leverage (records of Zhent bribes).

If PCs earn trust: she offers ‘off-book’ access to evidence lockers and patrol timing.

If PCs betray her: Harpers disappear from town; Zhentarim clock advances by 2.

Secret: Dora’s bloodline touches the lich’s mortal identity. She suspects the Gloomwaste ‘recognizes’ her family.

Leverage: Family records, an heirloom ring, or a recovered ruin-inscription naming the lineage.

If threatened: she pushes policy hard (spellcasting ban enforcement; militia funding) to suppress panic.

If PCs help: she provides resources, a discreet safehouse room, and a ‘family map’ that’s useless inside the Gloomwaste but reveals approach routes.

True: He saw the outer concentric walls and a keep that looked intact. He heard a ‘chorus’ in the fog (planar harmonic).

False: The ‘gold river’ and ‘talking statues’ are mostly drink-stretched tales.

If sobered: he can sketch the approach landmarks (still unreliable in Gloomwaste).

Hook: he once carried a token from a dead companion: it resonates near certain ruin glyphs.

name: NPC DOSSIER (GM): Zhentarim Handler Varron Dusk

text.content:
Secret: Varron is not the top of the chain. He answers to a higher agent who occasionally arrives as a ‘scribe’.

Operations: Uses Market Green fronts and a north-road cavern waystation to move contraband. Maintains a ‘violence cap’ to keep town safe and the Mayor compliant.

If pressured: he offers jobs, then traps PCs into complicity.

If exposed: he burns two pawns and relocates the waystation deeper.

Secret: Gildon quietly launders Zhentarim coin through ‘freight fees’ and ‘loss insurance’ and has done so long enough to be scared of stopping.

Leverage on him: His private ledgers (kept in a false-bottom lockbox) and a set of wax seals matching Zhentarim contracts.

What he wants: Stability. He will sell out anyone if it keeps markets open.

If PCs befriend him: He provides accurate supply forecasts and can point to who benefits from shortages.

If PCs threaten him: He plays dumb, then secretly informs Varron Dusk.

Advance Black Network Grip by +1 when: Gildon completes a ‘quiet’ shipment, PCs accept his ‘no questions’ job, or he reports PCs to Zhentarim.

Reduce Grayhaven Stability risk by -1 when: PCs secure a caravan deal via Gildon or stop a price spike.

Secret: Bessa has repaired two ‘mystery wagons’ for Zhentarim clients but refuses to know what was inside. Her shop marks those jobs with a private notch code.

Leverage: The notch code ledger, and a set of wheel spokes made from wood that ‘shouldn’t exist’ (tainted, slightly warm at night).

What she wants: To keep travelers alive. She hates politics and will resist being used as a pawn.

If PCs earn trust: She reveals which merchants are quietly moving goods at odd hours.

If PCs cross her: She refuses service and warns others, causing equipment costs/time to rise.

Bessa can identify early material taint: sour sap, gray-green stains, and wood that splinters like chalk. If PCs bring samples, she can point them toward the Gloomwaste fringe without saying the word ‘lich’.

Secret: Cyril is a Harper courier. His ‘crow verses’ are codes: certain rhymes indicate meeting points, and certain refrains name targets.

Leverage: A page of lyrics in thieves’ cant, or catching him passing a feather charm to Captain Voss.

What he wants: Actionable intel. He is bold, sometimes reckless.

If PCs prove themselves: He offers a Harper contact phrase and a safe meeting route to the south farmhouse hideout.

If PCs betray him: Harpers withdraw. ‘Helpful rumors’ dry up. Black Network Grip advances +2.

Advance Harper Intelligence by +1 when: PCs deliver coded messages successfully, protect Cyril, or bring him proof.

Advance Black Network Grip by +1 when: Cyril is compromised, tailed, or forced to flee.

Secret: Brinna has a quiet fear of magic. She witnessed a spell accident years ago and never healed from it.

Leverage: None external. The leverage is emotional: show competence, protect civilians, and keep things orderly.

What she wants: Clean patrols, fewer surprises, and proof before accusations.

If Stability worsens: She will support harsher measures, even if she dislikes them.

If PCs help her: She becomes a steady ally and can shield them from overzealous arrests.

Advance Militia Authority by +1 when: PCs assist checkpoints/patrols successfully.

Advance Stoutheart Resentment by +1 when: Brinna humiliates a halfling publicly or a patrol harms a civilian.

Secret: Pell hears a faint harmonic from the east during heavy fog. It is real: a side-effect of the lich’s planar projection work.

Leverage: Pell is motivated by fear for his family, especially his newborn daughter. Reassurance and protection win him.

What he wants: Someone brave to validate him.

If PCs investigate: the trail points to a fog pocket that behaves unnaturally (good omen lead into Gloomwaste mechanics).
If Pell is mocked or dismissed repeatedly, he stops reporting. The next east-gate incident becomes worse (missing child, tainted animal, or fog surge). Advance Grayhaven Stability +1.

name: NPC DOSSIER (GM): Brother Harun of the Dawn

text.content:
Secret: Harun’s ledger copies contain marginal notes from a long-dead priest who suspected ‘a will behind the blight’ (lich-adjacent truth).

Leverage: Protect the shrine’s reputation and people. He will trade access to records for help.

What he wants: A narrative that preserves hope without lies.

Risk: Harun can leak secrets accidentally if questioned harshly or if he panics.

Advance Harper Intelligence by +1 when: Harun provides ledger pages or old testimonies.

Advance Grayhaven Stability by +1 when: a shrine scandal breaks or a public humiliation occurs outside the shrine doors.

Secret: Hilda isn’t ‘just’ a spice seller. She keeps a mental map of who owes whom favors in Lowstone and can turn the neighborhood mood like a weather vane.

Leverage: Earn her trust. Protect her people. Pay fairly. Don’t threaten her family.

What she wants: Fairness. She dislikes Bramblefoot dominance but fears open conflict.

If PCs alienate her: the rumor mill turns against them quickly, even if she doesn’t intend harm.

Reduce Stoutheart Resentment by -1 when: PCs help Lowstone materially or respectfully.

Advance Stoutheart Resentment by +1 when: militia humiliates locals or Bramblefoots impose policy.

Secret: Odo has started setting illegal snares and pits on the outskirts without telling the militia. He believes officials won’t protect Lowstone farms.

Leverage: Offer real protection and respect. He will listen to those who act, not those who promise.

What he wants: His herd safe and his people not treated like expendable labor.

If ignored: he becomes a leader of ‘neighborhood justice’ (dangerous but understandable).

Advance Stoutheart Resentment by +1 when: Odo’s traps injure someone or militia dismisses farm losses.

Reduce Grayhaven Stability risk by -1 when: PCs solve the owlbear or protect farms.

Secret: Kellan found a tiny blight-tainted shard at the riverbank. It emits a faint hum at night and subtly draws curiosity.

Leverage: Care and honesty. He responds badly to threats, but strongly to protection.

What he wants: To be taken seriously, and to be brave.

If PCs leave him alone: he returns to the river or east marker stone and gets into real danger.

The shard can be a plot key: it resonates near specific ruin glyphs, briefly clarifying direction even when maps fail. Prolonged exposure risks Blight Affliction checks (GM uses your Gloomwaste mechanics).

name: NPC DOSSIER (GM): Caravan Master Sorn Dellik

text.content:
Secret: Sorn’s ‘highwaymen’ weren’t normal: the attackers fought like starving men but didn’t flinch properly, and had blackened nails and bruised veins. Early blight-taint or controlled pawns.

Leverage: Sorn will pay for safety and hates being forced to deal with Zhents, but he will if desperate.

What he wants: One successful run so he can keep his crew employed.

If PCs fail him: he considers quitting, which worsens trade and pushes Stability down.

Reduce Grayhaven Stability risk by -1 when: PCs escort Sorn successfully.

Advance Black Network Grip by +1 when: Sorn is forced to buy ‘protection’.

Secret: Sera believes the Gloomwaste is maintained, not accidental. She has seen fog pockets behave like ‘doors’ and heard the harmonic ‘chorus’ too.

Leverage: Respect her boundaries. She refuses to enter heavy fog or the east road marker area.

What she wants: To keep people alive, not to ‘win’ against the blight.

If PCs push her into fog: she panics or flees. If PCs respect her, she shares her best routes and warning signs.
Sera can teach PCs a few consistent ‘tells’ outside the Gloomwaste: birds go silent first, then insects vanish, then fog thickens, then direction feels ‘sticky’. These are early warning stages.

Secret: Vesk has personally walked the route to the cavern waystation and can identify three landmark tells: split pine, three stones, and cold breath (a draft from the cavern mouth).

Leverage: He fears Varron more than death. Promise protection and a new identity and he might crack.

What he wants: To complete assignments cleanly and move up.

If PCs capture him: he bargains with partial truths and tries to set a trap for whoever comes to retrieve him.

Advance Black Network Grip by +1 when: Vesk intimidates or buys off an NPC successfully.

Reduce Black Network Grip by -1 when: PCs publicly embarrass Vesk without killing him (reduces fear aura).
